etymology.description: Pictogram: a kneeling figure with an ugly mask-like face (甶); a small tail-like 厶 stroke was added later.
etymology.interpretation: Originally sketched as a crouching person wearing a grotesque mask, evoking an eerie, otherworldly presence. A later tail-like stroke emphasized its creaturely form and helped distinguish it from similar shapes.

examples.chinese: 夜里有人说看见了鬼(夜裡有人說看見了鬼)。
examples.pinyin: Yè lǐ yǒu rén shuō kànjiàn le guǐ.
examples.english: Someone said they saw a ghost at night.

examples.chinese: 他被鬼故事吓得不敢睡觉(他被鬼故事嚇得不敢睡覺)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bèi guǐ gùshì xià de bù gǎn shuìjiào.
examples.english: He was so scared by ghost stories that he didn’t dare to sleep.

examples.chinese: 别装神弄鬼(別裝神弄鬼)，快把真相说出来(快把真相說出來)。
examples.pinyin: Bié zhuāngshén nòngguǐ, kuài bǎ zhēnxiàng shuō chūlai.
examples.english: Stop putting on a spooky act and quickly tell the truth.
